body.p: Some stakeholders have suggested that the main purpose of the statement of financial position should be to provide information that helps assess the reporting entity’s solvency. The question is not whether information provided in the financial reports should be helpful in assessing solvency; clearly, it should. Assessing solvency is of interest to investors, lenders and other creditors, and the objective of general purpose financial reporting is to provide information that is useful to them for making decisions.
